strats.description: The very last hold uses six fingers, but the rest of the chart strategy only uses two.
strats.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Default
strategies.description: For this strategy you hit the pattern with two fingers. Hitting closer to the edge of the second regular note after the hold might help.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Multifinger 1
strategies.description: For this strategy you hit the notes right after the hold all with one hand, using middle finger where necessary.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Multifinger 2
strategies.description: For this strategy you split the screen into four lanes, where one finger hits everything in it's lane, just like classic 4k gameplay.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Default
strategies.description: For this strategy you do the pattern the intended way. Instead of thinking of this section as polyrhythm, you can alternatively think of it as a double (simultaneous taps) followed by a triplet. This pattern of double -> triplet -> double -> triplet stays true throughout the entire section, outside of the first finger swap between segment 1 and 2.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Crosshand
strategies.description: For this strategy you crosshand so that one hand does the holds and the other hits the notes.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: No Crosshand
strategies.description: For this strategy you treat the hold as many smaller holds, where you start holding from the regular notes.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Crosshand
strategies.description: For this strategy you crosshand so that one hand does the holds and the other hits the notes.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: No Crosshand
strategies.description: For this strategy you swap which hand takes care of the hold in order to avoid crosshanding.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Multifinger Cheese
strategies.description: By using six fingers to cover the entire screen, both the holds will be properly registered.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Crosshand
strategies.description: You can alternatively swap fingers in the beginning so that right hand hits the thin hold instead.
strategies.author: TheLetterP
